page.title: 03THE R.A.F. MUSEUM - HENDON
page.content: The R.A.F.Museum was opened in 1972. During the war,the Grahame White Aircraft factory and the London Aerodrome were all nearby. This is the reason for the present site of the Museum in which approximately 80 people work. Most of the planes in the Museum were in World War II and while some could work again, it would be a very expensive operation.The oldest plane here is called the Bleriot and a model of an early glider can also be seen in the Museum. In 1957,there was a large air exhibition which could be seen for miles around as the Grahame Park Estate had not been built.The Museum is a permanent reminder of the early days of flying and frequently attracts visitors from all over the world.
